required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pantheris Atherectomy Treatment of In-Stent Restenosis In Lower Extremity Arteries
clinical_study.official_title: INSIGHT: EvaluatIoN of the PantheriS OCT- ImaGing AtHerectomy SysTem For Treatment of In-Stent Restenosis (ISR) Lesions In Lower Extremity Arteries

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective, non-randomized, international, multi-center study to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of the Pantheris OCT-Imaging System to perform atherectomy in In-Stent Restenotic (ISR) lesions in lower extremity arteries.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a prospective, global, single-arm, multi-center study to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of the Pantheris OCT-Imaging System to perform atherectomy of in-stent restenotic (ISR) lesions in lower extremity arteries.
The trial will enroll up to 140 subjects diagnosed with peripheral arterial disease of the lower extremities that have previously been treated with stenting at up to 20 sites. The primary disease must be located in reference vessel diameter of >3.0mm and ≤7.0mm. Trial success is focused on safety, including rates of major adverse events through 30 days as adjudicated by a Clinical Events Committee, and effectiveness, which will be evaluated using technical success defined as the percent of target lesions that have residual diameter stenosis <50% post-treatment with the Pantheris device alone as assessed by Angiographic Core Lab.

primary_outcome.measure: Freedom from a composite of major adverse events (MAEs) through 30-day follow-up (safety)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 through 30 days post treatment procedure
primary_outcome.description: The primary safety endpoint is freedom from a composite of major adverse events (MAEs) through 30-day follow-up, as adjudicated by an independent CEC. Individual MAEs include: Cardiovascular-related death; Unplanned, major index limb amputation; Clinically driven target lesion revascularization (TLR); Myocardial infarction; or Device-associated events: Clinically significant perforation, Clinically significant dissection, Clinically significant embolus, or Pseudoaneurysm.

primary_outcome.measure: Technical success of Pantheris catheter treatment (efficacy) device
primary_outcome.description: The primary efficacy endpoint of technical success is defined as the percent of target lesions that have a residual diameter stenosis <50% post the Pantheris device alone, as assessed by an independent Angiographic Core Laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Stent structure freedom from new or worsening stent fracture post Pantheris treatment (safety)
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the stent for new or worsening stent fracture per comparative Pantheris OCT evaluation pre- and immediately post-procedure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Effectiveness Endpoint - Freedom from TLR
secondary_outcome.description: Freedom from TLR at 6 months as assessed by an independent CEC.

Procedural success defined as the percent of target lesions that have residual diameter stenosis ≤ 30% post-Pantheris and any other adjunctive therapy, determined by independent Angiographic Core Laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Effectiveness Endpoint - Freedom from TLR
secondary_outcome.description: Freedom from TLR at 12 months as assessed by an independent CEC.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 and 12 months post treatment procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Ankle-Brachial Index at 30 days, 6 and 12 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 and 12 months post treatment procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Rutherford Classification at 30 days, 6 and 12 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Effectiveness Endpoint - Use Adjunctive Devices
secondary_outcome.description: Adjunctive devices (stent placement (bare metal or drug eluting stent), drug eluting balloon or other) utilized during the index procedure.

intervention.description: Treatment of restenotic lesions within stents previously placed within the artery.

facility.name: Advocate Christ Hospital and Medical Center
University of Tennessee Health Science Center
